metadata.title: Defra Forms user research consent form

email.responseTime: We aim to respond within 2 working days

metadata.submissionGuidance:
Thank you for your participation!

We’ve received your consent to join our user research for the Defra forms project.

Your researcher will be in contact soon.

draft.name: Defra Forms user research consent form

pages.title: Defra Forms Digital Express Toolkit (DXT) user research

components.name: uivftS
components.title: Html
components.content:
Before you take part, we need to check you understand what's involved and record your consent.

About this research

We are doing this research to improve the usability and overall user experience of DXT, the tool the Defra Forms team is building to enable content designers and Digital Data and Technology Services (DDTS) teams to create and manage online forms.

This research will help to inform how we can improve not only the digital tool, but also whether any additional support should be put in place to help.

Who we are

This research is for Digital Express Toolkit (DXT) Delivery team at the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs (Defra).

Your researcher is Monica Ferraro from eSynergy, a company working with Defra. Monica is part of DDTS.

If you have questions, please email: monica.ferraro@defra.gov.uk.

components.name: iMKwOo
components.title: Html
components.content:
Taking part (or deciding not to) does not affect services or entitlements that you receive from us.

Right to withdraw from this research

You can withdraw your consent partially or fully by telling your researcher or emailing: DDTSUserResearchOperations@defra.gov.uk.

  • partially: you stop taking part but we can finish working on data already collected
  • fully: we erase all research data we still have that identifies you

Professional standards

Our researchers follow the Market Research Society's code of conduct. You can complain if they breach this.

components.name: xIJBEr
components.title: Html
components.content:
We may collect these categories of personal data for the following purposes:

  • name and contact details – to communicate with you about research, and to identify you solely in regards to the research
  • your views, experiences and observed behaviour – to improve Defra's internal software and how it can be improved
  • audio and video recordings – to record, analyse and present research findings
  • internet device details – to provide online services, analyse usage and detect misuse
  • disability and health – to understand how these affect using public services

We will keep this personal data for up to 2 years (unless you withdraw your consent).

Observing your research sessions

Defra staff and staff from suppliers working with Defra may observe your research sessions. No one from the DDTS Content team will observe the sessions. This allows those working the tool to better understand your experience.

pages.title: Your rights, including withdrawing your consent

components.name: gnUJfB
components.title: Html
components.content:
If you wish to withdraw your consent or make use of your other rights, tell the user researcher on this project. Alternatively, email UCDResearchOperations@defra.gov.uk.

Find out about your individual rights under the UK General Data Protection Regulation on the Information Commissioner's Office (ICO) website. You have the right to complain to the ICO at any time.

Defra follows the professional standards of the Market Research Society. You have the right to complain if you feel that we have breached their code of conduct.

Legal basis for processing your personal data

Our legal basis for data collected during research is consent. Explicit consent is used for sensitive (special category) personal data.

The data controller is the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs. The data protection officer can be contacted at dataprotection@defra.gov.uk.

components.name: TSvqhA
components.title: I am happy to be contacted occasionally in the future about taking part in other Defra research

components.name: nplREZ
components.title: Html
components.content:
Behaviour

We expect you to be respectful of Defra staff and other research participants. Abusive behaviour (such as derogatory language, physical violence or harassment) will not be tolerated.

Confidentiality

You might see ideas, designs or policies that are private. You should not tell anyone about these until they are made public. Your researcher will tell you if something is confidential.

Compensation

Sometimes incentives (such as shopping vouchers) will be offered as compensation for your time or travel, but this is not guaranteed. Your researcher will tell you if this is available.

components.name: ZiDgzP
components.title: I agree to the terms of participation

components.name: rEtwxu
components.title: Your name

components.name: HCMKJD
components.title: Your email address

components.name: CvqSii
components.title: Html
components.content:
What's involved for you

This research will involve:

  • being interviewed by a researcher over a Microsoft Teams video call for 60 minutes about how you currently work, the processes you're and the tools you use
  • testing out a prototype of the DxT tool either on a laptop or mobile device, sharing your screen and commenting on your experience of using it while being observed
  • discussing a topic with a small group of people, led by a researcher
  • testing the content of guidance documents and giving feedback
  • filling occasional surveys
  • as this is internal research, there's a risk that some staff working on this project might already know you
  • as your role is very specific, there's a risk that someone might be able to identify you from anonymous research findings

Our researchers will ask you about:

  • your daily job and what you do, to understand your background
  • how your team is organised and operates
  • your experience in designing online forms
  • how your health or disability, if any, affects you. this helps us to understand the different kinds of people that use our services and what they need

With your consent, we will:

  • create anonymous research reports of what we learn from you, what you say or do
  • optionally, make video or audio recordings to help researchers analyse your session
  • optionally, allow other staff working on this project to observe your session to help them learn

components.name: oDKsrw
components.title: Html
components.content:
How we'll use your data:

  • to create research insights to help improve government services
  • your data will only be viewed by relevant staff involved in this project
  • when research findings are reported, we anonymise your data, so you aren't identified
  • we'll keep your data for up to 3 years. we'll erase it sooner if further analysis or contact is unlikely

More details are set out in Defra's research privacy notice.

pages.title: Can other staff working on this project also observe your research session (either live or a recording) to help them learn?

live.name: Defra Forms user research consent form

components.name: uivftS
components.title: Html
components.content:
Understanding your participation

Find out who we are, the research we're doing, and how we'll use data about you. If you have questions that aren't answered here, please contact the researcher for this project or service.

Who we are and what we're doing

We are a team within DDTS looking at creating a form builder, that in the first instance can be used by the DDTS Content Team alongside the other tools you have access to.

We have Content Designers on our team, however we want to hear from the wider team (confidentially) about how you currently work so that can help us shape the form builder design

By taking part, you'll help to inform how we can improve not only a digital tool, but also whether any additional support should be in place to help.

Your researcher is Monica Ferraro. If you have any questions, email Monica.Ferraro@defra.gov.uk.

What's involved in taking part

This research will involve:

  • being interviewed by a researcher over a Microsoft Teams video call for 60 minutes about how you currently work
  • accessing an early prototype of the tool, sharing your screen and commenting on your experience of using it

We might also ask you for some more sensitive personal information such as disability. This helps us to understand the different kinds of people that use our services and what they need.

We'll ask you if we can make audio or video recordings to help us analyse our research findings.

Recordings may also be presented to staff working on government services to help improve these, but only with your consent.

components.name: iMKwOo
components.title: Html
components.content:
Taking part in this research is voluntary. You do not have to answer any questions you do not want to and can stop taking part at any time by telling the researcher.

You also have the right to withdraw entirely, any personal data we've collected will be deleted if you ask for this.

Whatever you decide, this will not affect your role in Defra whatsoever. This research is wholly separate to any performance monitoring or existing workflow arrangements with your manager.

components.name: xIJBEr
components.title: Html
components.content:
What personal data is collected and how it's used

We may collect these categories of personal data for the following purposes:

  • name and contact details – to communicate with you about research, and to identify you solely in regards to the research
  • your views, experiences and observed behaviour – to improve Defra's internal software and how it can be improved
  • audio and video recordings – to record, analyse and present research findings
  • internet device details – to provide online services, analyse usage and detect misuse
  • disability and health – to understand how these affect using public services

We will keep this personal data for up to 2 years (unless you withdraw your consent).

Observing your research sessions

Defra staff and staff from suppliers working with Defra may observe your research sessions. No one from the DDTS Content team will observe the sessions. This allows those working the tool to better understand your experience.

Defra follows the professional standards of the Market Research Society. You have the right to complain if you feel that we have breached their code of conduct.

Legal basis for processing your personal data

Our legal basis for data collected during research is consent. Explicit consent is used for sensitive (special category) personal data.

The data controller is the Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs. The data protection officer can be contacted at dataprotection@defra.gov.uk.
